questions.text: Regarding histoplasmosis and H. capsulatum, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Histoplasmosis occurs primarily in the tropical areas of Central and South America.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. In tissue biopsies, H. capsulatum is found as a yeast within macrophages.

questions.text: Regarding Bartonella henselae, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.text: BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid cyclers are more common in women than men

options.label: D
options.text: Depression is more common in rural areas

questions.correct_answer: B. BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

A 26-year-old woman presents with a palpable thyroid nodule shown in the image and needle biopsy demonstrates amyloid in palpable lymph nodes on the same side as the lesion. The preferred treatment should be:

options.label: A
options.text: Removal of the involved node, the isthmus, and the enlarged lymph node.

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of the involved lobe, the isthmus, a portion of the opposite lobe, and the enlarged lymph node

options.label: C
options.text: Total thyroidectomy and modified neck dissection on the side of the enlarged lymph node.

options.label: D
options.text: Total thyroidectomy and irradiation of the cervical lymph nodes.

questions.correct_answer: C. Total thyroidectomy and modified neck dissection on the side of the enlarged lymph node.

questions.text: In an attempt to teach medical students about a barium swallow, a volunteer undergoes this test and is incidentally discovered with the finding shown in the image. How should this patient be managed?

options.label: D
options.text: Resection with end to end anastomosis

questions.text: All of the following are indication for bariatric surgery except –

options.text: failure of other methods of weight loss

questions.correct_answer: C. BMI>30 with long standing diabetes

questions.text: Rotterdam criteria is used to evaluate

options.label: B

year-old G1 now P1 just delivered after a prolonged induction of labor due to being postdates. After the placental delivery she continues to bleed excessively. Initial intervention to address this bleeding is to activate the normal physiologic mechanisms. Which of the following is the most important hemostatic mechanism in combating postpartum hemorrhage?

options.label: A
options.text: Contraction of interlacing uterine muscle bundles

options.label: C
options.text: Intra myometrial vascular coagulation due to vasoconstriction

options.label: D
options.text: Markedly decreased blood pressure in the uterine venules

questions.correct_answer: A. Contraction of interlacing uterine muscle bundles

After a low forceps delivery for fetal intolerance, a mother continues to have excessive vaginal bleeding despite a well-contracted uterus. Which of the following locations is most likely to be the site of a vaginal laceration after an instrumented delivery?

options.text: Anterior upper third under the pubic symphysis

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior upper third from an incompletely evacuated rectum

options.label: D
options.text: Lateral middle third over the ischial spines

questions.correct_answer: D. Lateral middle third over the ischial spines

A 32-year-old woman with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) has infertility of 1-year duration. Her menses occur at irregular intervals, and BBTs are monophasic. An endometrial biopsy shows endometrial hyperplasia with mild cytologic atypia. Which of the following is the most appropriate therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: Failure of instrumental delivery is more common with the Ventouse.

options.label: B
options.text: Keilland's (rotational) forceps have a ‘pelvic curve’ which follows the sacral curve and a ‘cephalic curve’ for the head.

options.label: D
options.text: Instrumental delivery can be used once the cervix is 8 cm dilated.

questions.correct_answer: A. Failure of instrumental delivery is more common with the Ventouse.

questions.correct_answer: D. Family history of diabetes in a seconddegree relative
